ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a great course, and I would rather title the course "Topics in development." But, if a student has some knowledge in microecon and econometrics, this is a great course to take.
Would not recommend it to another student because the course felt disorganized and did not fell I got as much out of it as for other courses.
yes. this class gives a very deep discussion about frontier development research topics especially microfinance
Yes, recommend.Very inspiring, but the premise is to read the papers.
If you are interested in doing research or being a research assistant, you should take this course

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I am interested in development, which explains everything hopefully.
this class opens doors both in method and topics for us to explore our own development paper opportunities
Widen my horizon with a variety of readings.
It introduced a lot of familiar topics such as microfinance and growth models and the role of institutions - but covered these at a deeper and more engaging level, which I found very helpful.
The massive amount of reading increased my knowledge of micro finance
